title: iMet Collection 2019 - FGVC6
description: Recognize artwork attributes from The Metropolitan Museum of ArtThe Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, also known as The Met, has a diverse collection of over 1.5M objects of which over 200K have been digitized with imagery. The online cataloguing information is generated by Subject Matter Experts (SME) and includes a wide range of data. These include, but are not limited to: multiple object classifications, artist, title, period, date, medium, culture, size, provenance, geographic location, and other related museum objects within The Met’s collection. While the SME-generated annotations describe the object from an art history perspective, they can also be indirect in describing finer-grained attributes from the museum-goer’s understanding. Adding fine-grained attributes to aid in the visual understanding of the museum objects will enable the ability to search for visually related objects.    About This is an FGVCx competition hosted as part of the FGVC6 workshop at CVPR 2019. View the github page for more details.  This is a Kernels-only competition. Refer to Kernels Requirements for details.
